statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Jimmie Taylor leads Rider past Niagara, 69-60
article.headline: Jimmie Taylor leads Rider past Niagara, 69-60
article.linkText: Jimmie Taylor leads Rider past Niagara, 69-60
article.story: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y. -- Jimmie Taylor scored 15 points and Rider knocked off Niagara, 69-60 on Sunday to remain in second place in the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference. The Broncs (18-9, 12-4) are two games back of Iona going into Sunday's games. Rider needed a Kahlil Thomas layup and a Zedric Sadler jumper in the final 1:08 of the first half to forge a 33-33 tie going into intermission. The second of Taylor's back-to-back 3-pointers gave Rider the lead, 42-40 with 15:51 left and his layup with 10:10 left capped a 14-2 Rider run that put the Broncs firmly in charge. Teddy Okereafor finished with 13 points and five assists for Rider and Matt Lopez added 11 points. Rider shot an even 50 percent from the field (25 of 50), including 10 of 18 from beyond the arc. Emile Blackman scored 13 points and Ramone Snowden grabbed 10 rebounds to lead Niagara (4-21, 3-13).
